name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pok√©mon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

strengths: Thick Skinned prevents all status conditions
90 HP is excellent for a Basic
weaknesses: Body Slam only does 30 damage for 4 energy
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - Powers Body Slam
Switch - Work around massive retreat cost
counters: Gust of Wind - Force out, hard to retreat

competitiveHistory: Snorlax was a solid defensive option. Thick Skinned's status immunity was excellent against disruption strategies, and 90 HP made it durable. The 4 retreat cost was a significant drawback, but Switch cards could work around it.

rulings.ruling: Thick Skinned prevents Snorlax from becoming Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.
If Snorlax is already affected by a status condition (somehow applied before Thick Skinned was active), the power can't prevent new conditions until the existing ones are removed.
Thick Skinned is a Pokemon Power, so effects that turn off Pokemon Powers will disable it.
Body Slam's Paralysis only triggers on a heads coin flip.
